bibl.title: Letter from John R. Taylor to Philip Showalter Hench, December 6, 1941

div1.p: Taylor thanks Hench for arranging for the Wyeth Company to send him reprints of the yellow fever paintings.

div1.head: Letter from John R. Taylor to Philip Showalter Hench, December 6, 1941
div1.opener:
548 Grand Ave
Upper Darby, Pa.
Dec 6, 1941
Dr Phillip S. Hench.
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr Hench
div1.p:
I mailed you a letter yesterday
thanking you for sending me the article on Conquest
of Yellow Fever, and stating that I had received
from John Wyeth and Brother a large size
copy of the picture suitable for framing.
Today, I was surprised again by receiving
from John Wyeth and Bro a perfectly
framed picture for which I am thankful.
Such generosity merits appreciation.

I covered some of the points in your article
in my letter, so will conclude.
